ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:0.5_0: The training rule on receiving an almsbowl
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were looking here and there, and they did not know whether people were still giving or whether they had received too much. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.3.1_0: “‘I will receive almsfood with attention on the almsbowl,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.4_0: he should receive the almsfood with attention on the bowl;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood while looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.9_0: The eighth training rule is finished.
